New Records: Harry Kane became the 10th man to make 100 senior appearances for England and the third to mark the occasion with a goal.
Harry Kane scored two goals on his 100th appearance, extending his lead as England's leading goalscorer under the famous arch.
Harry Kane has 68 goals and 17 assists in 100 international appearances â€” a truly staggering record.
Key Match Events: England won the match 2-0 against Finland.
Harry Kane scored two goals, one in the first half and one in the second half.
Trent Alexander-Arnold created another five chances for England this evening, one of which was scored by Kane.
Ezri Konsa was injured in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Lee Carsley emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession.
Carsley said he's been out of his comfort zone during this international break but has been working hard to produce high standards.
Carsley praised Harry Kane's motivation and dedication to the team.
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Kane was proud to reach 100 caps and scored two goals to help the team.
Lee Carsley was happy with the team's performance and said they'll build on this result.
Kane said he's hungry and determined to prove people wrong and prove to himself that he can still play to a high level.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was one of nine being played around Europe in the Nations League.
Greece is still setting the pace in Group B2 with two victories from two.
England's schedule includes matches against Greece, Finland, Greece, and Republic of Ireland.
Others: Trent Alexander-Arnold has been brilliant in this international break, creating five or more chances in an international match for the fifth time since 2019.
Alexander-Arnold has secured his right-back spot for the foreseeable future.
The Finland fans enjoyed themselves at Wembley and the squad headed over to say thank you.
